column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had been prescribed a number of different medications for my migraines and this was the most effective.

column2: dk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried everything for migraines and have suffered with them for years. I was skeptical with this, but it worked fast, with minimal side effects. I am extremely happy with it. Wish there was a generic. Pricey, but fantastic.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Frova is the only drug that has ever been able to control my migraines. I got my life back because of Frova, I know it sounds dramatic, but without Frova, I really suffered with awful migraines for too many years! I'm very grateful that my dr allowed me to try Frova!

column2: tammy smith, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I had been suffering with a migraine headache for three days. I was taking two Fiorinol every 4-6 hours day and night without relief. On the third day, I was given a sample of Frovatriptan. Within two hours after taking the medication, I was painfree. It was wonderful to be free of the unrelenting pain. One pill...twelve hours later and I'm still pain free. I would definitely recommend this to others that suffer with migraines.

column2: rgiraffus@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Frova works to prevent for situations triggering a migraine, like: air travel, eye exam, dental work, or stressful social events where food with unknown triggers is served. Frova takes 2 hours to act so I take at very first hint and it lasts.

column2: Jenny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from menstrual migraines for over 30 years.  I've been taking Frova for approx. 4 years now.  It's the only thing that I have found that works for me.  Will usually make the headache go away within 2-3 hours.  Although I pay $188 for 9 tablets (with my insurance) I find it to be very well worth it.  But sure am hoping for a generic to come out.  Over $20/pill is alot, but if it works....

column2: AFH45, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was given this drug by a neurologist for my menstrual migraines.  Like so many, I initially balked at paying $40 for 6 pills, and actually switched to Excedrin (OTC) migraine medicine for awhile.  But recently, after having a major (2-day) migraine, I switched back to the Frova, and it has worked wonders!.  It relieved my migraine in less than 2 hours (if you take it at the first 'twinge'), and in the past, I only had to take 1 pill per day of my menstrual cycle.  I will continue to use it, as the alternative (being cheap!) is not worth it!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: took 1 dose and 2 hours later took another dose. No relief, more intense pain than 4 hours ago

column2: spookegal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've had mixed results.  I have taken two doses each time, some with no effect.  I'm pretty sensitive to medication so I did not take a third dose.  I have tried similar medications with the same results.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Absolutely no relief after 3 hours. This is our first time using Frova.  Altered breathing and heart rate; too nervous to take another dose.

column2: Georgia Girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had a mirgraine for over a week. My doc prescribed Frova for me. It is like I am taking nothing! This drug is totally useless.

column2: headachegirl22, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just got this and I'm ready fo one to come on.  All these great reviews have helped me relax about paying $55.00 for 9 pills.

column2: TRader, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I suffer from migrains during my cycle, this is a med that gives total relief in 3 hours or less. I am very satisfied with this drug!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been a migraine sufferer since the 3rd grade.  I have tried every medicine out there and this is the first to work without having horrible side effects.  I no longer cry myself to sleep.  My only hope now is that a generic is made because I pay $25 for 9 pills.  But dont get me wrong, its worth every penny!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have severe migraines during my menstrual cycle.  This medication elimanates the pain usually in less than tow hours, while I am still going on with regular activities.  Other medications I have tried in the past, I would take the med and then have to rest before it would even start to work, if at all.  Frova has given my life back that one week a month instead of dreading it.

column2: farahasam@hotmail.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Frova is an effective triptan so far used for my menstrual migraines... the best part is the side effects are so minimal, I dont have to miss out on work anymore..

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Cluster Migraine headaches for over 30 years and this is the best medication I have ever taken for them. I have had no side effects and it works fast. I wish I found this earlier in my life.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Exceptional helpful when Migraines come on.  I can get back to life instead of being out suffering in a dark room.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have used many types of migraine medications. I was weary to try thi one thinking its just another one thats not going to work, but to my surprise- not only did it work it has very few side effects.  I didnt have to make that choice of having my chest close up and not breathing, but my headaches are gone kinda of choice.
